channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish dumped at Heverham Road, 7th November
item.description:
Every week someone dumps black bags full of rubbish in this area. The rubbish consists of food and household waste so I know these people live around this area. It's disgusting and makes the area very unhygeinic. It also attracts flies and wild animals. Please can this be investigated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Reidhaven Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees and branches fallen blocking river, 7th November
item.description:
Near the memorial bench 'olivia scarlett lily wallis' there are trees and branches in the river and debris is collecting around it, which with falling leaves can only get worse and block river.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Five Arches, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole/Surfacing interface with covers, 7th November
item.description:
There are a few service covers/manholes within the southbound cycle lane on Lower Road which are not flush with the surfacing. This is especially problematic in the darker evenings and with leaf fall as it is harder to see in advance and avoid these when cycling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of rubbish dumped at corner of Queen Elizabeth Street/ Tower Bridge Road - second report, 7th November
item.description:
Your contractor has only removed the wheely bins, but just dumped and left all the rubbish, which was the main problem in this location. It's a disgrace, especially so near a world Heritage Site and major tourist attraction. I don't see how this can be considered 'resolved and the case closed'. Pleases reopen and can all the litter/ rubbish/ detritus be completely cleared?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 201, Tooley Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside the Angel pub, 7th November
item.description:
The temporary pedestrian crossing is dangerous as the traffic light warning southbound traffic is too far away (further up the road by Brooksby) and therefore traffic does not realise that pedestrians have a green man. I have just witnessed a bus make an emergency stop to avoid hitting people about to cross. In the drivers defence there wasnâ€™t a red traffic light instructing him to stop. I saw a different bus this morning go through the crossing when a green man was showing. Please fix this ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Highgate High Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
